channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Your Pup’s Dinner Can Have Greater Climate Impacts Than Your Own Meals
item.description: Depending upon formulation, dog food has a more variable — and sometimes larger — environmental pawprint than human diets.

item.title: Minneapolis is so unsafe in the ICE shooting aftermath that families can choose remote learning for their kids for the next month
item.description: That Minneapolis, a district of nearly 30,000 students, would willingly offer remote learning again suggests a new level of fear,

item.description: If we know who Sebastian Stan is playing in The Batman Part 2, that may confirm who Scarlett Johansson is playing as well.

item.title: Trump wants to cap credit card interest rates at 10%. But such limits could harm consumers, experts warn
item.description: On Friday, President Donald Trump called for a one-year cap on credit card interest rates at 10%, effective Jan. 20.

item.title: Noah Wyle Shares Some Early, Interesting ‘The Pitt’ Season 3 Info
item.description: The Pitt has been renewed for season 3, and star Noah Wyle is already talking about what to expect, and what not to.

item.title: Congress debates what to do about ICE after giving Trump billions of funding to expand the program
item.description: “The videos I’ve seen from Minneapolis yesterday are deeply disturbing,” said Sen. Lisa Murkowski, R-Alaska, in a statement.

item.title: No, Trump can’t use example of fraud in Minnesota to block childcare subisidies to 5 blue states, judge says
item.description: The five states say they receive a total of more than $10 billion a year from the programs.

item.title: Urgent recall: 13K chargers sold at TJ Maxx, Marshalls may explode during use
item.description: More than 13,000 wireless chargers sold in the U.S. at T.J. Maxx and Marshalls have been recalled over fears that they could "explode while in use."

item.title: Dallas mayor predicts 'avalanche' of NYC financial firms fleeing new socialist policies under Mamdani
item.description: Dallas Mayor Eric Johnson predicts financial firms will flee New York City for Texas as the Big Apple's new mayor pursues socialist policies.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
